list.description: Configuration guidance for implementing Pass-the-Hash mitigations. #nsacyber

list.name: Event-Forwarding-Guidance
list.description: Configuration guidance for implementing collection of security relevant Windows Event Log events by using Windows Event Forwarding. #nsacyber

list.name: AppLocker-Guidance
list.description: Configuration guidance for implementing application whitelisting with AppLocker. #nsacyber

list.name: Control-Flow-Integrity
list.description: A proposed hardware-based method for stopping known memory corruption exploitation techniques. #nsacyber

list.name: Maplesyrup
list.description: Assesses CPU security of embedded devices. #nsacyber

list.name: GRASSMARLIN
list.description: Provides situational awareness of Industrial Control Systems (ICS) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) networks in support of network security assessments. #nsacyber

list.name: Windows-Secure-Host-Baseline
list.description: Configuration guidance for implementing the Windows 10 and Windows Server 2016 DoD Secure Host Baseline settings. #nsacyber

list.name: goSecure
list.description: An easy to use and portable Virtual Private Network (VPN) system built with Linux and a Raspberry Pi. #nsacyber

list.name: LOCKLEVEL
list.description: A prototype that demonstrates a method for scoring how well Windows systems have implemented some of the top 10 Information Assurance mitigation strategies. #nsacyber

list.name: Splunk-Assessment-of-Mitigation-Implementations
list.description: Automatically scores how well Windows systems have implemented some of the top 10 Information Assurance mitigation strategies. #nsacyber

list.name: Certificate-Authority-Situational-Awareness
list.description: Identifies unexpected and prohibited certificate authority certificates on Windows systems. #nsacyber

list.name: WALKOFF
list.description: A flexible, easy to use, automation framework allowing users to integrate their capabilities and devices to cut through the repetitive, tedious tasks slowing them down. #nsacyber

list.name: simon-speck
list.description: The SIMON and SPECK families of lightweight block ciphers. #nsacyber

list.name: simon-speck-supercop
list.description: Fast implementations of the SIMON and SPECK lightweight block ciphers for the SUPERCOP benchmark toolkit. #nsacyber

list.description: Retrieves the definitions of Windows Event Log messages embedded in Windows binaries and provides them in discoverable formats. #nsacyber

list.name: unfetter
list.description: Identifies defensive gaps in security posture by leveraging Mitre's ATT&CK framework. #nsacyber

list.name: netman

list.name: netfil
list.description: A kernel network manager with monitoring and limiting capabilities for macOS. #nsacyber

list.name: nsacyber.github.io
list.description: NSA Cybersecurity. Formerly known as NSA Information Assurance and the Information Assurance Directorate

list.name: WALKOFF-Apps
list.description: WALKOFF-enabled applications. #nsacyber

list.name: AtomicWatch
list.description: Intel Atom C2000 series discovery tool that parses log files and returns results if a positive match is found. #nsacyber

list.name: serial2pcap
list.description: Converts serial IP data, typically collected from Industrial Control System devices, to the more commonly used Packet Capture (PCAP) format. #nsacyber

list.name: Driver-Collider
list.description: Blocks drivers from loading by using a name collision technique. #nsacyber

list.name: HTTP-Connectivity-Tester
list.description: Aids in discovering HTTP and HTTPS connectivity issues. #nsacyber

list.name: CodeGov
list.description: Creates a code.gov code inventory JSON file based on GitHub repository information. #nsacyber

list.name: Detect-CVE-2017-15361-TPM
list.description: Detects Windows and Linux systems with enabled Trusted Platform Modules (TPM) vulnerable to CVE-2017-15361. #nsacyber

list.name: Hardware-and-Firmware-Security-Guidance
list.description: Guidance for the Spectre, Meltdown, Speculative Store Bypass, Rogue System Register Read, Lazy FP State Restore, Bounds Check Bypass Store, TLBleed, and L1TF/Foreshadow vulnerabilities as well as general hardware and firmware security guidance. #nsacyber

list.name: HIRS
list.description: Trusted Computing based services supporting TPM provisioning and supply chain validation concepts. #nsacyber

list.name: BitLocker-Guidance
list.description: Configuration guidance for implementing BitLocker. #nsacyber

list.name: paccor

list.description: Supporting files for cyber challenge exercises. #nsacyber

list.name: waterslide
list.description: WaterSlide is a streaming event-at-a-time architecture for processing metadata. It is designed to take in a set of streaming events from multiple sources, process them through a set of modules ("kids"), and return meaningful outputs.

list.name: Scap Security Guide (SSG)
list.description: Security compliance content in SCAP, Bash, Ansible, and other formats

list.name: NB Gallery
list.description: nbgallery is a user-friendly Jupyter notebook sharing and collaboration platform.

list.name: Apache NIFI
list.description: Automates the flow of data between systems. NiFi implements concepts of Flow-Based Programming and solves common data flow problems faced by enterprises.

list.name: Open Network Operations Platform
list.description: Radically simplifies the operation of enterprise networks with SDN applications that reside on top of an OpenFlow-capable network controller.

list.name: RedhawkSDR
list.description: A software-defined radio (SDR) framework designed to support the development, deployment, and management of real-time software radio applications.

list.name: SECURITY-ENHANCED LINUX (SELINUX)
list.description: A mandatory access control mechanism in the Linux kernel that checks for allowed operations after standard discretionary access controls are checked. It can enforce rules on files and processes in a Linux system, and on the actions they perform, based on defined policies. SELinux has been part of the Linux kernel since version 2.6.0.

list.name: SECURITY ENHANCEMENTS FOR ANDROID (SEANDROID)
list.description: Confines privileged processes based on security policies by enforcing mandatory access control over all Android processes. SE for Android has been part of Android since Android 4.3.
